content:
It is understandable to feel frustrated about the use of personal data by companies without explicit consent. While it is difficult to opt out of all data collection completely, there are some steps you can take to protect your privacy.

Some browser extensions and mobile apps can help to block online trackers and disable third-party cookies that are used to collect data on your browsing behaviour. Additionally, privacy-focused search engines and messaging apps can help to limit the amount of data collected about you.

It's also important to be mindful of the information you share online and to only provide what is necessary. For instance, avoid submitting sensitive data on social media platforms and ensure the privacy settings of your social media accounts are set to maximum protection.

Overall, protecting your privacy is a continuous effort that involves staying informed and vigilant about the data you share and the online services you use.
